result.execSummary:
The defendant Shiloe M. Viau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $500.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No contact with the premises of the Spice Store located in Plainfield, Wisconsin.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.  No Good Time Credit.  Huber Privileges granted within the rules of the Huber Program.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shiloe M. Viau

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 15CF-53 and 15CM-354 - Both Cases Called @ 9:50 AM: Defendant Shiloe M. Viau in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement will call for DRI of 15CM-354 - no claim for Rest and all confiscated items have been returned.  Agreement on resolution recited by DA as to 15CF-53 with argued terms on sentencing.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  Court entertains waiver of Pre-Lim hearing as to 15CF-53.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of Pre-Lim Hrg with probable cause finding.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CF-53 Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   15CM-354 DRI.   Argument by DA as to cond'l time being imposed of 6 mos.  Stipulation as to 55 days TS credit.  Argument by Atty Wallace - ATR already implemented.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  S/W - 3 yrs probation.  Conditions:  6 mos WCJ - serve forthwith, 55 days TS credit; AODA and any follow thru as recommended;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; NC with Spice Store in Plainfield; Court Costs with $100 Buy money - 60 DTP or PP.  Law requires that DNA sample must be provided, may already be accomplished in another felony conviction and Jailer will be able to confirm that fact.  No right to petition for expungement of DNA record due to nature of conviction.  The Court is not willing to I/S any add'l conditional time to invite another ATR with DOC.  Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John H. Wallace in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wallace states resolution has been reached & requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.
NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Shiloe M. Viau not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John H. Wallace in court appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Wallace requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John H. Wallace in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Wallace requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:12 PM: Defendant Shiloe M. Viau in court, in custody, with attorney John H. Wallace.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits of 20 days for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 09:25 am.
from the DA's Office with attached drug buy money reimbursement request - $100

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:17 PM: Defendant Shiloe M. Viau in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin, appearing via telephone.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  DA Hendee argues for $500 Cash Bond.  SPD argues for lower cash bond or signature bond.   The Court:  $500 Cash Bond ordered w/conditions.  IA Scheduled.   Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
